intro: Houstonia umbratilis, commonly known as the shadowy bluemontain, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are small, blue to violet in color, and bloom in early spring. Houstonia umbratilis is often found in association with other woodland flora, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
